items.text: I am a second-year master's student based in the Tokyo metropolitan area.
Inspired by competitive programming, I became interested in personal projects and was gradually drawn to the field of software engineering.
At university and in graduate school, I developed a background in Computer Vision and conducted research primarily on knowledge distillation-based Federated Learning.
Through my experience as a student intern at multiple companies, I plan to begin my career as a platform engineer.
My hobbies are reading technical books and managing the lab's servers.
My goals for 2026 are to contribute and present in multiple technical communities and to develop a habit of exercise.

items.title: Getting Started with Chrome Extension Development in React
textList: Published a beginner's guide to developing Chrome extensions with React and TypeScript, as there were no systematic documents available.
Learn by developing a practical translation Chrome extension like DeepL in a hands-on format.
Ranked #1 on Zenn's Trending Books (February 2023). A revised edition was released in February 2024, and the second edition in March 2025.

items.title: Development of a Resource Label Monitoring Tool for Cost Management in the Cloud
textList: My work as an intern at CyberAgent, Inc. was featured on the Developers Blog.
I developed a tool to monitor resource labels to facilitate cost management in ABEMA's large-scale cloud environment.
The source code and Terraform for deployment are available on GitHub.

items.title: Increasing the Memory Limit of OOMed CronJobs 'Just Right' to Reduce Unnecessary Billing and Incident Response
textList: My work as an intern at M3, Inc. was featured on the tech blog.

I developed 'broom', a Custom Controller that increases the memory limit 'just right' when an OOM occurs in a Kubernetes CronJob, aiming to solve problems from both cloud billing and incident response aspects.
Broom is open-sourced on GitHub and is still under active development.

items.title: Migrating the Log Infrastructure from Fluentd to Fluent Bit and Implementing a Monitoring Tool
textList: My work as an intern at Mirrativ, Inc. was featured on the tech blog.
I carefully documented the investigation of the cause of log loss in the existing infrastructure, the migration from Fluentd to Fluent Bit, and the implementation of a Fluent Bit monitoring tool.
It ranked #2 on Hatena Bookmark's hot entries (Technology).

items.title: International Science School 2019 - The University of Sydney
Soft-Label Caching and Sharpening for Communication-Efficient Federated Distillation
items.text: We propose SCARLET, a communication-efficient distillation-based Federated Learning framework. By caching soft-labels to minimize redundant transmission and utilizing an enhanced Entropy Reduction Aggregation, it achieves up to 50% communication cost reduction while maintaining competitive accuracy.
